CONIKS Java Reference Implementation v1.1 API Specification

CONIKS is a key management service that provides consistency and privacy for end-user public keys.

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
org.coniks.coniks_common
Provides the classes common to the simple CONIKS test client and the basic CONIKS server.
org.coniks.coniks_server
Provides the classes necessary to create a basic CONIKS server, as well as the classes this server uses maintain the publicly auditable key directory and to perform the CONIKS protocols with CONIKS clients.
org.coniks.coniks_test_client
Provides the classes necessary to create a simple CONIKS test client, as well as the classes this clients uses to perform the CONIKS protocols with a CONIKS server.
CONIKS is a key management service that provides consistency and privacy for end-user public keys. It protects users against malicious or coerced key servers which may want to impersonate these users to compromise their secure communications: CONIKS will quickly detect any spurious keys, or any versions of the key directory that are inconsistent between two or more users. Nonetheless, CONIKS users do not need to worry about or even see these protocols, or the encryption keys, as CONIKS integrates into any existing secure messaging application.
